pullRequest.title: GH-2017 SHACL support for advanced targeting
pullRequest.bodyText:
Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:
Support for:

sh:hasValue #2301
sh:targetShape #2017
dash:AllObjectsTarget and dash:AllSubjectsTarget #2302
dash:valueIn (missing github issue)


PR Author Checklist:

 my pull request is self-contained
 I've added tests for the changes I made
 every commit message starts with the issue number (GH-xxxx) followed by a meaningful description of the change
 every commit has been signed off

Note: we merge all feature pull requests using squash and merge. See RDF4J git merge strategy for more details.

nodes.bodyText:
Example of the SPARQL target support.
Note: You have to include prefixes in the string. We don't support sh:prefixes!
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+@base <http://example.com/ns> .
+@prefix ex: <http://example.com/ns#> .
+@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .
+@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .
+@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
+@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .
+@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .
+@prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>.
+
+ex:PersonShape
+	a sh:NodeShape  ;
+		sh:target [
+                		a sh:SPARQLTarget ;
+                		sh:select """
+                		        PREFIX ex: <http://example.com/ns#>
+                                        PREFIX owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#>
+                                        PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
+                                        PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
+                                        PREFIX sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#>
+                                        PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
+
+                			SELECT ?this
+                			WHERE {
+                				?this a rdfs:Resource .
+                			}
+                			""" ;
+                ] ;
+
+	sh:property [
+		sh:path foaf:age ;
+		sh:datatype xsd:int ;
+
+	] .
+

nodes.bodyText:
An example of the new predicate+object target support.
You can have as many rdf4j-sh:compoundTarget as you want, but each one can only have a single rdf4j-sh:targetPredicate and single rdf4j-sh:targetObject. For the time being at least.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+@base <http://example.com/ns> .
+@prefix ex: <http://example.com/ns#> .
+@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .
+@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .
+@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
+@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .
+@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .
+@prefix rdf4j-sh: <http://rdf4j.org/schema/rdf4j-shacl#> .
+
+ex:PersonShape
+	a sh:NodeShape  ;
+
+        rdf4j-sh:compoundTarget [
+	        rdf4j-sh:targetPredicate rdf:type;
+	        rdf4j-sh:targetObject ex:Person
+	];
+
+        rdf4j-sh:compoundTarget [
+	        rdf4j-sh:targetPredicate rdf:type;
+	        rdf4j-sh:targetObject ex:SecondTarget
+	];
+
+	sh:property [
+		sh:path ex:knows ;
+		sh:and ( [sh:class ex:Person]  [sh:class ex:Human])
+	] .
+

nodes.bodyText: Use this main method to compare performance between SPARQL targets and predicate+object targets. The benchmarks test how the number of targets already present in the database affect the performance of a standard number (and size) of transactions.

nodes.bodyText:
I think this is what causes your current compile failure - on the develop branch, the import for XMLSchema in this class has been replaced with XSD. CI tries to build the PR after merging, and fails because it misses the import.
Easiest way to fix is to rebase and then replace this reference with XSD.
This copyright header looks a bit odd: it's missing the full lines of asterisks at beginning and end.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,32 @@

nodes.bodyText: I have chosen to go with the more natural naming rather than the forced uppercase.
This is to be able to make sure that the getTargetFilter on NodeShape only operates on the base connection.
Removed doesn't guarantee to only return this that have been removed, but must return everything that could potentially have been removed. So this implementation will be fine.
AllSubjectsTarget is the only place where we are supporting sh:filterShape currently.
